groundTruth.text:
Abstract
                  The ability to integrate resources and share knowledge across organisations empowers scientists to expedite the scientific discovery process. This is especially crucial in addressing emerging global challenges that require global solutions. In this work, we develop an architecture for distributed self-driving laboratories within The World Avatar project, which seeks to create an all-encompassing digital twin based on a dynamic knowledge graph. We employ ontologies to capture data and material flows in design-make-test-analyse cycles, utilising autonomous agents as executable knowledge components to carry out the experimentation workflow. Data provenance is recorded to ensure its findability, accessibility, interoperability, and reusability. We demonstrate the practical application of our framework by linking two robots in Cambridge and Singapore for a collaborative closed-loop optimisation for a pharmaceutically-relevant aldol condensation reaction in real-time. The knowledge graph autonomously evolves toward the scientist’s research goals, with the two robots effectively generating a Pareto front for cost-yield optimisation in three days.

problem.title: Enabling Collaborative and Autonomous Scientific Discovery Through Distributed Knowledge Integration
problem.description: The challenge of designing scalable, interoperable, and autonomous systems that can integrate distributed resources, share knowledge dynamically, and enable real-time collaborative experimentation across geographically dispersed entities. This problem spans scientific discovery, engineering optimization, and multi-agent systems, where seamless coordination, data provenance, and adaptive knowledge representation are critical for accelerating innovation in complex, global challenges.

templateData.title: Technical Framework for Collaborative and Autonomous Scientific Discovery via Distributed Knowledge Integration
templateData.description: Template for evaluating technical implementations of AI-driven systems that enable real-time collaboration, dynamic knowledge sharing, and autonomous experimentation across distributed scientific entities. Focuses on scalability, interoperability, and adaptive coordination mechanisms.

templateProperty.label: Distributed System Architecture
templateProperty.description: Named architecture or framework used to enable distributed knowledge integration (e.g., federated learning, multi-agent systems, blockchain-based coordination).

templateProperty.label: Knowledge Representation Model
templateProperty.description: Formal model or ontology used for encoding and sharing knowledge (e.g., RDF, OWL, knowledge graphs, vector embeddings).

templateProperty.label: Interoperability Protocol
templateProperty.description: Standard or protocol ensuring cross-system compatibility (e.g., HTTP/REST, gRPC, MQTT, GA4GH for genomics, OPC UA for industrial systems).

templateProperty.label: Real-Time Synchronization Mechanism
templateProperty.description: Technique for ensuring real-time or near-real-time knowledge updates (e.g., CRDTs, operational transformation, event sourcing).

templateProperty.label: Autonomy Algorithm
templateProperty.description: Algorithm enabling autonomous decision-making (e.g., reinforcement learning, automated planning, swarm intelligence).

templateProperty.label: Scalability Metric (Nodes/Second)
templateProperty.description: Quantitative measure of system scalability, e.g., maximum nodes supported per second or throughput in knowledge updates/sec.

templateProperty.label: End-to-End Latency (ms)
templateProperty.description: Average or 95th-percentile latency for knowledge propagation across the distributed system, in milliseconds.

templateProperty.label: Data Provenance Method
templateProperty.description: Technique for tracking data lineage (e.g., W3C PROV, blockchain hashes, immutable logs).

templateProperty.label: Collaboration Protocol
templateProperty.description: Named protocol or algorithm for coordinating multi-entity collaboration (e.g., consensus algorithms, auction-based resource allocation).

templateProperty.label: Adaptive Learning Rate
templateProperty.description: Dynamic adjustment mechanism for knowledge integration rates (e.g., gradient-based, Bayesian optimization).

templateProperty.label: Benchmark Dataset
templateProperty.description: Standardized dataset used for evaluating system performance (e.g., OpenML, Kaggle datasets, domain-specific benchmarks).

templateProperty.label: Fault Tolerance Mechanism
templateProperty.description: Technique for handling node failures or network partitions (e.g., Byzantine fault tolerance, checkpointing, self-healing).

templateProperty.label: Knowledge Fusion Algorithm
templateProperty.description: Algorithm for merging conflicting or complementary knowledge (e.g., Bayesian fusion, Dempster-Shafer theory, attention-based aggregation).

templateProperty.label: Security Protocol
templateProperty.description: Protocol for ensuring data integrity and confidentiality (e.g., TLS 1.3, homomorphic encryption, zero-knowledge proofs).

templateProperty.label: Energy Efficiency (kWh/Operation)
templateProperty.description: Energy consumption per knowledge integration operation or per node-hour.

templateProperty.label: Primary Evaluation Metric
templateProperty.description: Key quantitative metric for success (e.g., F1-score, discovery acceleration factor, collaboration efficiency).

templateProperty.label: Baseline System for Comparison
templateProperty.description: Existing system or method used as a performance baseline (e.g., centralized knowledge bases, manual collaboration).

templateProperty.label: Deployment Environment
templateProperty.description: Infrastructure used for deployment (e.g., Kubernetes, AWS Lambda, edge devices).

templateProperty.label: API Specification
templateProperty.description: Link to formal API documentation (e.g., OpenAPI, GraphQL schema) for system integration.

templateProperty.label: Reproducibility Script Repository
templateProperty.description: URL to code/scripts for reproducing experiments (e.g., GitHub, Zenodo).

templateProperty.label: Publication Date
templateProperty.description: Date when the research was published or preprinted.

templateProperty.label: Cross-Domain Applicability
templateProperty.description: Description of how the system generalizes across domains (e.g., biology to materials science).

templateProperty.label: Cost per Operation (USD)
templateProperty.description: Monetary cost per knowledge integration operation (e.g., cloud compute costs, energy costs).

overall.comments: It would be great to have a visual representation of the extracted template.
While extraction all these information, it would be nice to have similar papers/comparisons from ORKG.
